text.textblock: In accordance with the Federal Advisory Committee Act (Pub. L. 92-463, as amended), the National Science Foundation announces the following three meetings of the Special Emphasis Panel in Biological Sciences (1754).
Date and Time: March 14-16, 1994; 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Place: Room 320, National Science Foundation, 4201 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, VA.
Contact Person: Dr. Eve Barak (703) 306-1442 and Dr. Jerry Johnson (703) 306-1439, Program Managers, National Science Foundation, 4201 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, VA 22230.
Agenda: To review and evaluate Research Planning and Career Advancement proposals for Women Scientists and Engineers as part of the selection process for awards.
Date and Time: April 13-15, 1994; 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Place: Room 330, National Science Foundation, 4201 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, VA.
Contact Person: Dr. DeLill Nasser (703) 306-1439 and Dr. Ann Sakai (703) 306-1481, Program Managers, National Science Foundation, 4201 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, VA 22230.
Agenda: To review and evaluate Postdoctoral Research Fellowships in Molecular Evolution proposals as part of the selection process for awards.
Date and Time: April 18-20, 1994; 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Place: Rooms 360 and 360-2, National Science Foundation, 4201 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, VA.
Contact Person: Dr. DeLill Nasser (703) 306-1439 and Dr. Gary Cecchini (703) 306-1443, Program Managers, National Science Foundation, 4201 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, VA 22230.
Agenda: To review and evaluate NSF Young Investigator proposals as part of the selection process for awards.
Purpose of Meetings: To provide advice and recommendations concerning support for research proposals submitted to the NSF for financial support.

Reason for Closing: The proposals being reviewed include information of a proprietary or confidential nature, including technical information; financial data, such as salaries; and personal information concerning individuals associated with the proposals. These matters are exempt under 5 U.S.C. 552b(c) (4) and (6) of the Government in the Sunshine Act.

doctitle.textblock: Special Emphasis in Biological Sciences; Notice of Meetings
